title: Mutua Kilai, PhD
text:
I am a Lecturer in the Department of Pure and Applied Sciences ,School of Pure and Applied Sciences at Kirinyaga University
My Research and teaching focus on:

Statistical Modeling
Mathematical Statistics
Data Science
Machine Learning
Spatial Statistics

I am an author and maintainer of the following three R packages

NovelDistns
rKenyaForex
AHSurv

Creator of the following Overleaf Latex Template KyU Thesis Template
I also provide statistical consultancies including statistical and methodological services at an affordable fee.

title: Introduction to Data Visualization
text:
Introduction
This material gives an introduction to Data Visualization in Python for Beginners.
For more details you can consult the following reference materials:

Data Visualization with Python for Beginners. Visualize Your Data Using Pandas, Matplotlib and Seaborn
Data Visualization with Python and JavaScript. Scrape, Clean, Explore and Transform Your Data







Important



Codes are given in this tutorial. You can copy and paste them on your pc.


Install Anaconda on your Laptop. For details on how to install anaconda see here


Data Science and Data Visualization






Data Science



This is the science of extracting and exploring data in order to find patterns that can be used to make decisions in organizations.








Data Visualization



This is a subdomain of data science where you visualize data with the help of graphs and tables in order to identify important patterns.


Visualizing data graphically can reveal trends that otherwise may be hidden from the naked eye of a person.
Data visualization is a step to important processes such as:

Data Science
Machine Learning
Business Intelligence
Data Analytics

Data Visualization is one of the important skill sets of this century if you want to secure a data science job
Please you can watch this video on A Data Scientists Perspective of the importance of data visualization to data science






Writing Your First Program
In order to write a program in Anaconda, you have to launch Anaconda Navigator.
Search Anaconda Navigator in your Windows Search Box. Once you click on the application the Anaconda’s dashboard will open.
We will use the Jupyter Notebook in this resource.

The top right corner of Jupyter Notebook’s own dashboard houses a New button, you have to click to open a new document. From the dropdown that has several options click on Python 3.

A new Jupyter Notebook will appear that looks like this

The Jupyter Notebook consists of cells that makes its layout very simple and straightforward.
We can write our first program as:
print("Welcome to Data Visualization with Python")

Important Requirements: Anaconda, Jupyter, Matplotlib

All the scripts in this tutorial are written in Jupyter Notebook
We will explore the following visualization modules:

Matplotlib
Seaborn
Pandas
Plotly



To install a python library use the following in a Jupyter Notebook cell
# install pandas library

!pip install pandas
To load any Python library use

# loading library

import pandas as pd


Python Variables and Data Types
In a programming language data types refers to the type of data that the language is capable of processing.
In Python the major data types supported include:

Strings
Integers
Floating Point Numbers
Booleans
Lists
Tuples
Dictionaries

For more details see Crash Course in Python


Data Visualization Libraries






Matplotlib



Matplotlib is the default static data visualization in Python.
Many wrappers libraries like Pandas and Seaborn have been developed on top of Matplolib








Seaborn



This library is built on top of the Matplotlib library and contains all the plotting capabilities of Matplotlib.








Basemap



This is an extension of the Matplotlib and is used for plotting Geographical Maps in Python








Pandas



Pandas library, like Seaborn, is based on the Matplotlib library and offers utilities that can be used to plot different types of static plots in a single line of codes.








Plotly



Plotly is an online data visualization platform that supports interactive data visualization. More will be explored.








Importance of Data Visualization




A good visualization:

Communicates a piece of complex information in a simple, clear and concise manner to top business leaders
Enables users focus on actionable insights
Provides insights and story to establish business goals by giving attention to unnoticed patterns
Helps businesses make real-time decisions

title: Data Visualization Using Matplotlib and Seaborn
text:
We explore how to do various visualizations using the matplolib and seaborn libraries in Python.
We shall learn the following in this tutorial:

The fundamentals of plotting figures
Creating sub-plots in Python
Creating animations in Python

To decide which software to use between R and Python for data visualization you can watch this video.

title: Data Visualization Using Matplotlib and Seaborn
text:
Line Graph

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
yield_maize = [0.895, 0.91, 0.919, 0.926, 0.929, 0.931]
plt.plot(yield_maize)
plt.show()





Customizing the x-axis
We can add the year in the x-axis and have

year = [2021,2022,2023,2024,2025,2026]
yield_maize = [0.895, 0.91, 0.919, 0.926, 0.929, 0.931]
plt.plot(year,yield_maize)
plt.show()






Axis Labels

plt.plot(year, yield_maize)
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Yield")
plt.title("Yield Harvest per year")

Text(0.5, 1.0, 'Yield Harvest per year')







Line Markers
For line graphs, you can have markers for the line you are plotting. See full details of line markers in matplotlib

plt.plot(year, yield_maize, marker = "o")
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Yield")
plt.title("Yield Harvest per year")

Text(0.5, 1.0, 'Yield Harvest per year')







Styling the Lines
The function plt.plot supports many arguments for styling markers and the lines

color or c This sets the line color
ls Gives you to choose between solid or dashed line
lw sets the line width

To see more details of the function see the documentation


Using Seaborn
To make your chart more appeasing you use some default styles form Seaborn library.

Whitegrid style

sns.set_style("whitegrid")
plt.plot(year, yield_maize, marker = "o")
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Yield")
plt.title("Yield Harvest per year")

Text(0.5, 1.0, 'Yield Harvest per year')







darkgrid style

sns.set_style("darkgrid")
plt.plot(year, yield_maize, marker = "o")
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Yield")
plt.title("Yield Harvest per year")

Text(0.5, 1.0, 'Yield Harvest per year')

title: Introduction to Latex
text:
Introduction

LaTex is a typesetting system suitable for producing scientific and mathematical documents

LaTex enables authors to typeset and print their work
LaTex is pronounced as “Lay-tech”
Tex is the typesetting engine used by LaTex

title: Introduction to Latex
text:
Motivation






Encouragement


The ideal situation occurs when the things we regard as beautiful are also regarded by other people as useful ~ Donald Knuth









Goal


Making your math look good!!!









Disclaimer


This is just an introduction to the basics of typesetting in Maths. For more details you can explore further on your own.

title: Introduction to Latex
text:
Overview

Quick Introduction
Setup + Demo
Group work in breakouts
Parting thoughts

title: Introduction to Latex
text:
LaTeX is a programming language


Advantages

Math is displayed nicely and easy to edit
Required in Post-graduate courses
Good for writing research articles


Disadvantages

There is a steep learning curve






Dr. Mutua Kilai,PhD

text:

Disadvantages

title: Introduction to Latex
text:
Installing Latex

Description on installing MikTex for Windows users.
Download MikTex from here then download TexStudio Editor
MikTex is a package that contains all the needed programs for converting a file once it has been written as well as an integrated version of the front end program.







Important


Follow the steps and directions during installation. Install the basic package.

title: Introduction to Latex
text:
Basic File Extensions in LateX







File Extensions
Significance




.tex
Contains symbols and text written in the editor


.aux
Data files for cross referencing and across compilers


.log
Compiler information, warnings, error warnings


.dvi
Main output file of initial TeX

title: Introduction to Latex
text:
Cont’d







File Extensions
Significance




.ps
PostScript files


.cls
Class file containing commands,environment


.sty
Style file containing macro definitions and other extensions


.pdf
Common output format


.bib
Bibliography entries

title: Introduction to Latex
text: Getting Started

title: Introduction to Latex
text:
Easiest way to start

Click on Wizards then select Quick Start.



Box


Explanation

Quick Start enables you quickly start a Latex document
Quick Beamer Presentation enables beamer slides

title: Introduction to Latex
text:
Cont’d


Dialogue Box


Explanation

Document class Latex has options article,report,letter,book, beamer
Typeface Size gives the font size 10pt, 11pt and 12pt are the options
Paper Size Gives the paper size of your document

title: Introduction to Latex
text:
Geometry Settings


Geometry


Explanation

You set the Page size of your document by specifying the width and height
Set the margins by specifying the left, right, top and bottom margins

title: Introduction to Latex
Introduction to Latex
text:
Error Handling

If during compilation the compiler spits out an error then:

Don’t panic!
Read the error message which will also point you to the source of the error
Correct the error and recompile

If the error message looks cryptic just head straight to Google or Tex Stack Exchange

title: Introduction to Latex
text:
The Document


Document Class

The actual syntax of the documentclass command is

\documentclass[options]{class}
Font Size

Options 10pt, 11pt and 12pt

\documentclass[11pt]{article}

Paper Size (in)



class
Paper size




letterpaper
\(11\times 8.5\)


legalpaper
\(14\times 8.5\)


executivepaper
\(10.5\times 7.2\)


a4paper
\(20.7 \times 21\)


a5paper
\(21 \times 14.8\)

text:

The video is 4 hours long. It is worth it..



Click here to watch the video



Dr. Mutua Kilai,PhD

title: Introduction to Latex
Introduction to Latex
Introduction to Latex
Introduction to Latex
text:
Maths and Equations


We Learn

Inline Math
Equations
Fractions
Matrices


Modes of Typesetting

One is embedding the math directly into your text by encapsulating your formula in dollar signs
The other mode is using predefined math environment

title: Introduction to Latex
text:
Using inline Math



To make use of inline math feature, simply write your text and if you need to typeset a single math formula, surround it with dollar signs.

The area of a circle is defined as
$A = \pi r^{2}$
For a trigonometric function
$x = \sin(x)$


Output



For centered intext equation you can use double dollar signs

$$A = \pi r^2$$

title: Big Data Analytics
text:
Analytics is defined as the process of extracting and creating information from new data by the process of filtering and bringing data into context





This comprises of analyzing past data to present it in a summarized form which can be easily interpreted.
The aim is to answer the question What happened





This is the analysis of past data to diagnose the reasons as to why certain events happened
The aim is to answer the question Why did it happen





This comprises of predicting the occurence of an event or likely outcome of an event
The aim is to answer What is likely to happen





This uses multiple prediction models to predict the various outcomes and best course of action for each outcome
The aim is to answer What can we do to make it happen

A summary is given in Table below:



Analytics
What it Entails




Descriptive
What happened


Diagnostic
Why did it happen


Predictive
What is likely to happen


Prescriptive
What can we do to make it happen

title: Big Data Analytics
text:
Characteristics of Big Data

Volume: The data is so large that it cannot fit on a single machine therefore need specialized tools.
Velocity This refers to how fast the data is generated
Variety: This refers to the forms of the data; structured, unstructured and semi-structured.
Veracity This is how accurate the data is
Value The usefulness of the data for the intended purpose
